statements.name: PROC KPCA
statements.help:
PROC KPCA <options>;                 
	DISPLAY <table-list></ options>;                 
	DISPLAYOUT  table-spec-list </ options>;                 
	ID variables;                 
	INPUT  variables;                 
	KERNEL kernel-type / kernel-parameter;                 
	LRAPPROXIMATION <options>;                 
	OUTPUT  OUT=libref.data-table<option>;                 
	PREIMAGE <options>;                 
	SAVESTATE  RSTORE=libref.data-table<option>;

arguments.name: CENTER
arguments.description: centers the observations by the mean of each column

arguments.name: CENTROIDS=
arguments.description: specifies the name of the output table for the centroids that are generated by clustering

arguments.name: DATA=
arguments.description: names the input data table for PROC KPCA to use

arguments.name: EIGENVAL=
arguments.description: specifies the name of the output table that contains the eigenvalues

arguments.name: EIGENVEC=
arguments.description: specifies the name of the output table that contains the eigenvectors

arguments.name: METHOD=
arguments.description: specifies the method to use in performing KPCA

arguments.name: NTHREADS=
arguments.description: specifies the number of threads per computation node

arguments.name: ORDER
arguments.description: considers the order of the observations in the input data set on the basis of the KPCA_ROWID variable (or the ROWID variable if the KPCA_ROWID variable is absent) to generate consistent results when data are distributed on multiple grid nodes

arguments.name: RANKTHRESHOLD=
arguments.description: specifies the value of epsilon for determining the rank of the kernel matrix

arguments.name: SCALE
arguments.description: scales the observations by the standard deviation of each column

statements.name: DISPLAY
statements.description: enables you to specify a list of display tables to display or exclude

arguments.name: CASESENSITIVE
arguments.description: performs a case-sensitive comparison of table names in the table-list to display table names when tables are subsetted for display

arguments.name: EXCLUDE
arguments.description: displays all display tables except those that you specify in the table-list

arguments.name: EXCLUDEALL
arguments.description: suppresses display of all tables

arguments.name: TRACE
arguments.description: displays the display table names, labels, and paths

statements.name: DISPLAYOUT
statements.description: enables you to create output tables from your displayed output

arguments.name: key=
arguments.description: specifies key as the ODS table name, path, or partial pathname, and specifies value as the output table name.

arguments.name: key
arguments.description: specifies key as the ODS table name and also as the output table name.

arguments.name: INCLUDEALL
arguments.description: creates output tables for all display tables

arguments.name: NOREPLACE
arguments.description: does not replace any existing output table of the same name

arguments.name: REPEATED
arguments.description: replicates all output tables on all nodes

statements.name: ID
statements.description: lists one or more variables to be copied from the input data table to the output data tables that are specified in the OUTPUT statement and the EIGENVEC= option in the PROC KPCA statement, and also to the file that is specified in the RSTORE= option in the SAVESTATE statement

statements.name: INPUT
statements.description: specifies the names of variables to be considered in the KPCA procedure

statements.name: KERNEL
statements.description: specifies the type of kernel and any associated parameters to use during training

arguments.name: LINEAR
arguments.description: specifies that the kernel type is linear

arguments.name: POLYNOMIAL
arguments.description: specifies that the kernel type is in the polynomial form

arguments.name: RBF
arguments.description: uses a radial basis function (also known as the Gaussian kernel function) during training

statements.name: LRAPPROXIMATION
statements.description: specifies the parameters of the low-rank approximation method

arguments.name: CCRITERION=
arguments.description: specifies a double value for the convergence criterion in k-means clustering

arguments.name: CLUSMETHOD=
arguments.description: specifies the method of seed initialization in k-means clustering to generate the centroids

arguments.name: FC
arguments.description: stands for fast clustering, which spreads out the initial seeds in a heuristic way

arguments.name: KMPP
arguments.description: spreads out the initial seeds by introducing a weighted probability distribution in seed selection

arguments.name: RANDOM
arguments.description: selects initial seeds by pure randomization

arguments.name: MAXCLUS=
arguments.description: specifies the maximum number of clusters to use in k-means clustering

arguments.name: MAXITER=
arguments.description: specifies the maximum number of iterations to use in k-means clustering

statements.name: OUTPUT
statements.description: creates an output data table to contain the results of the procedure run

arguments.name: OUT=
arguments.description: names the output data table for PROC KPCA to use

arguments.name: NPC=
arguments.description: specifies the number of principal components to display

statements.name: PREIMAGE
statements.description: specifies the pre-image method and any associated parameters to use during training

arguments.name: METHOD=
arguments.description: specifies the method to use for pre-image training

arguments.name: ITERATIVE
arguments.description: uses the iterative method to find the pre-image

arguments.name: {MAP
arguments.description: uses the mapping method to find the pre-image

arguments.name: CENTROIDSPC=
arguments.description: specifies the name of the output table to contain the centroids of the points in the principal component space that are generated by k-means clustering

arguments.name: KERNEL=
arguments.description: specifies the kernel type for the kernel ridge regression to be used in the mapping method

arguments.name: LINEAR
arguments.description: uses a linear kernel for the kernel ridge regression in the mapping method

arguments.name: POLYNOMIAL
arguments.description: specifies that the kernel type in the kernel ridge regression of the mapping method is in the polynomial form

arguments.name: {RBF
arguments.description: uses a radial basis function (also known as the Gaussian kernel function) in the kernel ridge regression of the mapping method

arguments.name: L2=
arguments.description: specifies a numeric value for the L2 regularization parameter of the kernel ridge regression to be used in the mapping method

arguments.name: MAPCOEFFS=
arguments.description: specifies the name of the output table to contain the coefficients of the pre-image mapping method

arguments.name: NPC=
arguments.description: specifies a positive integer value as the number of principal components to use in pre-image training

statements.name: SAVESTATE
statements.description: creates an analytic store for the model and saves it as a binary object in a data table

arguments.name: RSTORE=
arguments.description: specifies the name of the table in which to save the analytic store

arguments.name: EXACTSCORE
arguments.description: specifies the exact method of scoring
